article_title: Planet Fitness charge draws questions on PPACA tanning tax
article_text:
Ashley Pratte is a spokeswoman for the Young America’s Foundation, a conservative group.

When Ashley Pratte moved from New Hampshire to the nation’s capital, she quickly located the nearest Planet Fitness center. “I already had my membership from New Hampshire and didn’t want to change gyms,” she said.

But when she got to the club, she saw a notice at the front desk informing members with Black Card memberships that they would henceforth be charged a nickel a month to cover a tanning tax “required by the implementation of the Affordable Health Care Act.”

article_metadata.sailthru.author: Dan Cook
article_metadata.description: The more Ashley Pratte looked into her nickel-a-month tax, the more confusing the situation became.

article_summary:
When Ashley Pratte moved from New Hampshire to the nation’s capital, she quickly located the nearest Planet Fitness center.
Ashley Pratte is a spokeswoman for the Young America’s Foundation, a conservative group.
But when she got to the club, she saw a notice at the front desk informing members with Black Card memberships that they would henceforth be charged a nickel a month to cover a tanning tax “required by the implementation of the Affordable Health Care Act.”
“I already had my membership from New Hampshire and didn’t want to change gyms,” she said.
